system.description:
Poison dipped spears are the most common form of projectile weapon in Gatusan. Oftentimes deadlier than bullets, as the spears thrown - bamboo with firehardened tips - are hard to get out, embed deeper, and can spread horrible poison. Javelins are a trained class of spear throwers that rival even the best of archers and gunners.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Throw Javelin. rush 1, then attack an enemy in range 5 with Bravery, and then rush 1.

Gambits [[/r d10]]

1-3: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

4-6: Rush > Rush > Inflict Violence

7-9: Rush > Snake Venom [1]: The Javelin's next attack inflicts poison. If a target is already poisoned, inflict +1d. > Inflict Violence

10: Rush > Inflict Violence > Spear Palisade [1]: Put down a wall on any side of a tile within range 4.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: It's Time To Raid!
traits.description: At the beginning of a Resound, the Gatusan fighters choose a single enemy in the field as their Raid Target. All their attacks against the Raid Target gain Overwhelming. If that enemy is brought to 0 HP, all Gatusan fighters in the field can heal 2 and move 2.

traits.name: Pinning Spears
traits.description: When the Javelin attacks from vantage, inflict Slow. If they're already Slow, inflict Bleed. The Javelin gains Evade against attacks from enemies that are slowed or bleeding.
